summary:
Jean-Pierre Kempeneers is acting head of the Dutch Embassy in Port of Spain in August 2023. He was acting deputy Head of the Embassy  in Warsaw from October 2022 until April 2023. He has been on special assignments at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands since 22 August 2022. Before that he was Ambassador, National Coordinator International Positions at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands since August 2016.

From early 2014 until summer 2016 he worked at Royal Philips as Senior Director Government Relations & European Affairs and Head of the Philips' European Office in Brussels.

Jean-Pierre is a frequent lecturer and moderator at student-/university events. Since March 2013 he has been lecturer, moderator, and co-designer of the Brussels module of Avicenna, Academy for Leadership. He has also co-designed training modules with (Z)LTO Academy for agri- and horticultural professionals.

He has been coach and mentor to various (young) professionals for more than 15 year.

Jean-Pierre has been a diplomat in the Dutch MFA since 1995. He worked in the Europe Department covering 29 European countries with his team. He was Human Rights chief in the Ministry and Deputy Director of Human Rights, Humanitarian Aid, Good Governance, and Emancipation.

From 2006-August 2010 he was Head of the Political Section of the Permanent Representation of the Netherlands to the United Nations in New York. He was also the spokesman of the Mission.

Before this he was the Chief of Cabinet of / Private Secretary to the Minister for European Affairs of the Netherlands from 2002-2006.

From 1995-2002 he dealt with EU enlargement in both the Dutch and Austrian MFA's, served at the Dutch Embassy in Vienna covering Austria and Slovenia and he was Head of the Economic and Trade section of the Dutch Embassy in Tel Aviv.

Before joining the MFA Jean-Pierre worked in the European Parliament as speechwriter to the President of the Liberals, Mr. Gijs de Vries.
In 1994 he was intern in the European Commission dealing with the Middle East.

He was participant in the Government wide leadership course of the Dutch Government from Jan 2012-Dec 2013.

In January 2010 he participated in the UN Senior Mission Leadership Course in Port Dickson, Malaysia. Jean-Pierre was rated best participant and top three participant of the last 11 courses (approx. 300 participants) by the mentors.

He is a lawyer by education. 

Jean-Pierre is an avid sportsman (running, cycling, soccer, skiing, skating, golf, tennis) and coaches a football team under 14 years and is often referee.

education.field_of_study: Law, International Public Law, European Law

school.name: Institut des Sciences Politiques à Paris

education.field_of_study: Politique extérieure de la France, droit publique

profile_positions.location: Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago
profile_positions.title: Acting head of the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Port of Spain
Acting Head of the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Warsaw

profile_positions.description: Government wide mandate to further appointments of Dutch sr. professionals in international organizations like the UN, World Bank, IMF, NATO, OECD, OSCE, Council of Europe, Development Banks
profile_positions.title: Ambassador, National Coordinator International Positions at Dutch MFA
Senior Director Government Relations and European Affairs

profile_positions.description: Responsible with my team for the bilateral relations of the Netherlands with 29 European countries including Germany, Belgium, Luxemurg, France, Spain, Portugal, Italy, the Balkan, Romania, Bulgaria, Greece, Turkey, Austria, Switzerland.
profile_positions.title: Europe Department, Head of Division / Team leader

profile_positions.description: As Deputy Director leading and managing the Department of Human Rights, Emergency Aid, Good Governance, and Emancipation together with the Head of Department. Leading and managing the Human Rights Section of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Contribution to policy making through reports, advice and analysis on Human Rights in particular (UN, EU, NATO, OSCE, Council of Europe, bilateral).
profile_positions.title: Human Rights Chief, Deputy Director Human Rights, Humanitarian Aid, Good Governance, Gender

profile_positions.description: Leading and managing the Political Section of the Permanent Representation of the Netherlands to the UN composed of 6 diplomats, 2 secretaries, two junior civil servants and four interns. Contribution to policymaking through reports, advice and analysis on Security Council issues, conflict prevention, peacekeeping, peacebuilding, Security Sector Reform, peace and justice, the Responsibility to Protect, the 1st, 4th, 5th and 6th Committees of UNGA. Coordinator of the Security Council for the Netherlands. Spokesman of the Mission.
profile_positions.title: Head of Political Section

profile_positions.description:
Leading and managing the office of the Minister for European Affairs of the Netherlands composed of a spokesman, a speechwriter, a political assistant, an EU communication adviser, two secretaries, two drivers.
Contribution to policy making through advice to the Minister. Accompanying the Minister on all his trips and foreign travels. Responsible for all information on paper to and from the Minister.
profile_positions.title: Private Secretary to the Minister for European Affairs

profile_positions.description:
Leading and managing the economic section of the Embassy of the Netherlands to Israel composed of two trade promotion experts, a secretary/office manager and an intern. Analysis of the Israeli economy and market. Promotion of Dutch trade to Israel and promotion of Israeli investments in the Netherlands.
Contribution to policy making through reports, advice and analysis on the Middle East Peace Process.
profile_positions.title: Head of the Economic Section

skills: Foreign Policy, diplomacy, Europe, EU, UN, Human Rights, Trade Promotion.
